doc.after: After the collapse of the Ottoman Empire following World War I Beirut along with the rest of Lebanon was placed under the French Mandate Lebanon achieved independence in 1943 and Beirut became the capital city The city remained a regional intellectual capital becoming a major tourist destination and a banking haven citation needed especially for the Persian Gulf oil boom
